org.smpp.pdu

Class ByteData

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.smpp.SmppObject
      • org.smpp.pdu.ByteData
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Address, AddressRange, ByteDataList, DestinationAddress, DistributionList, PDU, PDUHeader, ShortMessage, TLV

    public abstract class ByteData
extends SmppObject
    Base class for all object which can be transformed to sequence of bytes and which can be re-read from sequence of bytes. The sequence of bytes is represented by ByteBuffer. Every descendant of this class must implement setData and getData functions. Apart from abstract methods this class contains static methods for checking of validity of certain values like if the length of string is within valid boundary, if the date format is valid etc.
    Version:
    $Id: ByteData.java 72 2008-07-15 19:43:00Z sverkera $
    Author:
    Logica Mobile Networks SMPP Open Source Team
    See Also:
    setData(ByteBuffer), getData()

    • Method Detail

      • setData

        public abstract void setData(ByteBuffer buffer)
                      throws PDUException,
                             NotEnoughDataInByteBufferException,
                             TerminatingZeroNotFoundException
        This abstract method should parse the buffer with binary data passed as parameter into member variables.
        Parameters:
        buffer - the data which should contain binary representation of the class
        Throws:
        PDUException - some data in the buffer were invalid
        NotEnoughDataInByteBufferException - expected more data in the buffer
        TerminatingZeroNotFoundException - the c-string in buffer wasn't terminated with 0 zero
        See Also:
        getData()

                            throws ValueNotSetException
        This abstract method should create a binary buffer from it's member variables.
        Returns:
        the binary data buffer created from member variables
        Throws:
        ValueNotSetException - thrown from a TLV if the value was requested but never set
        See Also:
        setData(ByteBuffer), TLV, ValueNotSetException

      • checkString

        protected static void checkString(String string,
                                  int max,
                                  String encoding)
                           throws WrongLengthOfStringException,
                                  UnsupportedEncodingException
        Checks if the length of the data of the string is less or equal than the provided maximum; necessery for multibyte encodings. Note that the length checked is the length wfter transforming the string to series of octets, so two-byte strings will efectively require space (max size) two-times the length of the string.
        Parameters:
        string - the string to check
        max - the maximal length of the string
        encoding - the encoding of the string
        Throws:
        WrongLengthOfStringException - thrown if the string is longer than the provided max length
        UnsupportedEncodingException - the required encoding isn't supported

      • decodeUnsigned

        protected static short decodeUnsigned(byte signed)
        Allow a variable of type byte to carry lengths or sizes up to 255. The integral types are signed in Java, so if there is necessary to store an unsigned type into signed of the same size, the value can be stored as negative number even if it would be positive in unsigned case. For example message length can be 0 to 254 and is carried by 1 octet i.e. unsigned 8 bits. We use a byte variable to read the value from octet stream. If the length is >127, it is interpreted as negative byte using negative complement notation. So length 150 would be interpreted as Java byte -106. If we want to know the actual value (*length) we need to make a correction to a bigger integral type, in case of byte it's short. The correction from (negative) byte to short is
        (short)(256+(short)length)
        This converts the negative byte value representing positive length into positive short value.
        See Also:
        encodeUnsigned(short)

      • decodeUnsigned

        protected static int decodeUnsigned(short signed)
        Provides correction of positive unsigned 2 byte carried by (signed) short into positive signed int. See explanation in decodeUnsigned(byte).
        See Also:
        decodeUnsigned(byte), encodeUnsigned(int)

      • encodeUnsigned

        protected static byte encodeUnsigned(short positive)
        Complementary operation to decodeUnsigned.
        See Also:
        decodeUnsigned(byte)

      • encodeUnsigned

        protected static short encodeUnsigned(int positive)
        Complementary operation to decodeUnsigned.
        See Also:
        decodeUnsigned(byte), decodeUnsigned(short)
